channel.title: Cpp on The Indian Engineer
channel.description: Recent content in Cpp on The Indian Engineer

item.title: Problem 131 Palindrome Partitioning
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 131 Question Given a string s, partition s such that every substring of the partition is a palindrome.

item.title: Problem 78 Subsets
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 78 Question Given an integer array nums of unique elements, return all possible subsets (the power set).

item.title: Problem 1863 Sum of All Subset XOR Totals
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1863 Question The XOR total of an array is defined as the bitwise XOR of all its elements, or 0 if the array is empty.

item.title: Problem 2331 Evaluate Boolean Binary Tree
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2331 Question You are given the root of a full binary tree with the following properties:

item.title: Problem 1219 Path With Maximum Gold
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1219 Question In a gold mine grid of size m x n, each cell in this mine has an integer representing the amount of gold in that cell, 0 if it is empty.

item.title: Problem 861 Score After Flipping Matrix
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 861 Question You are given an m x n binary matrix grid.

item.title: Problem 2373 Largest Local Values in a Matrix
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2373 Question You are given an n x n integer matrix grid.

item.title: Problem 786 K th Smallest Prime Fraction
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 786 Question You are given a sorted integer array arr containing 1 and prime numbers, where all the integers of arr are unique.

item.title: Problem 3075 Maximize Happiness of Selected Children
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 3075 Question You are given an array happiness of length n, and a positive integer k.

item.title: Problem 506 Relative Ranks
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 506 Question You are given an integer array score of size n, where score[i] is the score of the ith athlete in a competition.

item.title: Problem 2816 Double a Number Represented as a Linked List
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2816 Question You are given the head of a non-empty linked list representing a non-negative integer without leading zeroes.

item.title: Problem 2487 Remove Nodes From Linked List
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2487 Question You are given the head of a linked list.

item.title: Problem 237 Delete Node in a Linked List
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 237 Question There is a singly-linked list head and we want to delete a node node in it.

item.title: Problem 881 Boats to Save People
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 881 Question You are given an array people where people[i] is the weight of the ith person, and an infinite number of boats where each boat can carry a maximum weight of limit.

item.title: Problem 2000 Reverse Prefix of Word
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2000 Question Given a 0-indexed string word and a character ch, reverse the segment of word that starts at index 0 and ends at the index of the first occurrence of ch (inclusive).

item.title: Problem 1137 Nth Tribonacci Number
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1137 Question The Tribonacci sequence T(n) is defined as follows:

item.title: Problem 752 Open the Lock
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 752 Question You have a lock in front of you with 4 circular wheels.

item.title: Problem 1971 Find if Path Exists in Graph
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1971 Question There is a bi-directional graph with n vertices, where each vertex is labeled from 0 to n-1 (inclusive).

item.title: Problem 1992 Find All Groups of Farmland
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1992 Question You are given a 0-indexed m x n binary matrix land where a 0 represents a hectare of forested land and a 1 represents a hectare of farmland.

item.title: Problem 200 Number of Islands
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 200 Question Given an m x n 2D binary grid grid which represents a map of '1's (land) and '0's (water), return the number of islands.

item.title: Problem 463 Island Perimeter
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 463 Question You are given row x col grid representing a map where grid[i][j] = 1 represents land and grid[i][j] = 0 represents water.

item.title: Problem 623 Add One Row to Tree
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 623 Question Given the root of a binary tree and two integers val and depth, add a row of nodes with value val at the given depth depth.

item.title: Problem 129 Sum Root to Leaf Numbers
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 129 Question You are given the root of a binary tree containing digits from 0 to 9 only.
